skill.name: file-boundaries
skill.description: Pattern for respecting file ownership boundaries during implementation. Prevents conflicts in parallel work.
skill.summary: Pattern for respecting file ownership boundaries during implementation. Prevents conflicts in parall...
skill.author: Clouder0

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and guidance rules. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls, no command execution. The skill teaches agents to respect file ownership boundaries, which is a safety mechanism.

content.value_statement: Parallel AI agents often conflict when editing the same files. This skill teaches agents to recognize and respect ownership boundaries, preventing lost work and merge conflicts during collaborative implementation.
actual_capabilities: Define which files an agent owns versus reads
Report boundary violations instead of proceeding
limitations: Cannot modify files outside owned boundaries
Must be loaded alongside other implementation skills

use_cases.title: Parallel development
use_cases.description: Enable multiple AI agents to work on different parts of the codebase simultaneously without conflicts.

use_cases.title: Enforce ownership rules
use_cases.description: Ensure agents only modify files they are explicitly assigned to own or modify.

use_cases.title: Controlled changes
use_cases.description: Divide large refactoring tasks across agents with clear ownership boundaries to prevent overlap.

prompt_templates.title: Basic ownership check
prompt_templates.prompt: Check if src/components/button.ts is in my owned files list before modifying it.

prompt_templates.title: Read-only reference
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to read src/types/api.ts for reference. I can read it but cannot modify it.

prompt_templates.title: Report violation
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to modify src/utils/auth.ts but it is not in my owned files. Report BLOCKED status with details.

prompt_templates.title: Parallel safety check
prompt_templates.prompt: Verify my boundaries against src/api/ endpoints. I own src/api/users/ but not src/api/auth/.

output_examples.input: Check if I can modify src/auth/login.ts
output: âœ“ src/auth/login.ts is in your owned files list
You can read, modify, create, or delete this file

best_practices: Define clear ownership boundaries before starting parallel work
Always report boundary violations instead of working around them
Use owned files for modifications, read-only files for reference
anti_patterns: Assuming permission to modify files not in your ownership list
Working around boundaries to complete tasks faster
Modifying shared utility files without explicit permission

faq.question: What tools support file-boundaries?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It is a prompt-based pattern, not a standalone tool.

faq.question: What happens when I hit a boundary?
faq.answer: You must report BLOCKED status with details. Do not attempt to modify files outside your ownership.

faq.question: Can I modify read-only files?
faq.answer: No. Read-only files can be imported and referenced but cannot be modified. Request permission to change boundaries.

faq.question: How are boundaries configured?
faq.answer: Boundaries are defined in the skill configuration under owns and reads arrays specifying file paths.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only provides guidance rules. It does not access files, network, or execute code.

faq.question: How is this different from .claudeignore?
faq.answer: .claudeignore blocks files entirely. File-boundaries allows read access while restricting modification to owned files.
